intro: Eriocaulon mangshanense, commonly known as the Mangshan marsh plant, is a rare species of flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Eriocaulaceae, which includes grass-like plants often found in wetland environments. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of tiny, white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded habitats, typically in mountainous regions with high humidity. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
